title: Conditions

and.description: All conditions in this list must be met

or.description: Any conditions in this list must be met

^url[=~]?$.description: Matches the full URL, including request parameters

^url\\.path[=~]?$.description: Matches the path only. Path does not include the query string.

^client_name[=~]?$.description: Matches the client's company or ISP name

^client_country_code[=~]?$.description: Matches the ISO 3166-1 country code (two letters)

^client_gmt_offset[<=>]?$.description: UTC offset for the client's time zone. Values look like -100 or 300.

^time[<=>]?$.description: Absolute time of the request, evaluated against UTC

^time_day[<=>]?$.description: Day of the week, same as Date.getDay() – adjusted for GMT offset

^time_date[<=>]?$.description: Day of the month, same as Date.getDate() – adjusted for GMT offset

^time_hours[<=>]?$.description: Hour of the day, same as Date.getHours() – adjusted for GMT offset

^time_minutes[<=>]?$.description: Minute of the hour, same as Date.getMinutes() – adjusted for GMT offset

^time_month[<=>]?$.description: Month of the year, same as Date.getMonth() – adjusted for GMT offset

^time_year[<=>]?$.description: Year, same as Date.getFullYear() – adjusted for GMT offset

^url_param\\..+[~]?$.description: Matches a URL parameter's value as a string

^url_param\\..+[<>]$.description: Matches a URL parameter's value as a number

^url_param\\..+[=]$.description: Matches a URL parameter's value as a number or string

^preflight\\..+[~]?$.description: Matches a preflight response header value as a string

^preflight\\..+[<>]$.description: Matches a preflight response header value as a number

^preflight\\..+[=]$.description: Matches a preflight response header value as a number or string
